content:
• Monday, July 11, 2011
  • ABVT

    AboveNet (ABVT -4.5%) dipped today after another DealReporter story says private-equity interest...

    AboveNet (ABVT -4.5%) dipped today after another DealReporter story says private-equity interest in buying the company has stalled. The company retained JPMorgan in May to explore a sale, and since that time has seen its stock frequently whipsawed by buyout speculation.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • NCR

    NCR will be acquiring Radiant Systems (RADS), a maker of point-of-sale systems for the...

    NCR will be acquiring Radiant Systems (RADS), a maker of point-of-sale systems for the hospitality and specialty retail industries, for $28/share in cash, or $1.2B. NCR sees the acquisition adding a "third core industry vertical" to the company, in addition to its finance and retail offerings (PR). NCR shares are up 2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • IP

    International Paper (NYSE:IP) takes its $30.60/share offer (about $3.3B) for Temple-Inland...

    International Paper (NYSE:IP) takes its $30.60/share offer (about $3.3B) for Temple-Inland (NYSE:TIN) to the shareholders, launching a tender offer after being rebuffed by management. TIN launched a stockholder-rights plan in defense. AH: IP +2.2%; TIN +0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • NVLS-OLD

    Novellus Systems (NASDAQ:NVLS-OLD): Q2 EPS of $0.79 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $350.2M (+9% Y/Y)...

    Novellus Systems (NASDAQ:NVLS-OLD): Q2 EPS of $0.79 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $350.2M (+9% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -1.87% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • MSCC

    Microsemi (MSCC +1.7%) is upgraded by Oppenheimer, citing the recent pullback in shares driven...

    Microsemi (MSCC +1.7%) is upgraded by Oppenheimer, citing the recent pullback in shares driven by exaggerated concerns over defense spending which creates a compelling buying opportunity. The firm adds that the company stands out by offering investors a "rare combination of best-in-group visibility, steadily growing backlog and margin expansion."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • LVS

    While Nevada gambling revenue surged in May, Rodman & Renshaw says much of the growth was...

    While Nevada gambling revenue surged in May, Rodman & Renshaw says much of the growth was due to Strip casinos doubling baccarat winnings during a month that included a big boxing match. "Fight fans tend to be gamblers, and major boxing cards bring high-rollers into town," Rodman writes. Las Vegas properties trade lower: LVS -4.7%, WYNN -2.8%, MGM -6.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR -6.7%) hits new intraday lows after announcing a secondary offering to...

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR -6.7%) hits new intraday lows after announcing a secondary offering to repay debt, expand its Utica Shale oil project, and fund a new drilling venture in Thailand.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • CLX

    Clorox (CLX +2.4%) is easily the S&P's top gainer, as call options surge to 27x their...

    Clorox (CLX +2.4%) is easily the S&P's top gainer, as call options surge to 27x their four-week average. There are no apparent rumors surrounding the stock, although Clorox has been the subject of takeover chatter on several occasions over the years. The most-active options contracts were July $70 calls, which expire at the end of this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • NWSA

    The News Corp. (NWSA -7.4%) phone-hacking scandal has grown to include allegations that the...

    The News Corp. (NWSA -7.4%) phone-hacking scandal has grown to include allegations that the personal information of some of the UK's most powerful figures, including PM Gordon Brown, was illegally accessed. In addition, Scotland Yard is accusing unidentified individuals of trying to sabotage their investigation.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • BIDU

    Shares of Chinese internet firms sink, giving backs gains from a strong rally in the sector...

    Shares of Chinese internet firms sink, giving backs gains from a strong rally in the sector since June. Losers: BIDU -3%, RENN -8.6%, SINA -6.2%, DANG -7.7%, NTES -3.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • BAC

    Analysts expect more bad news later this week for investment banks, already stinging from Europe...

    Analysts expect more bad news later this week for investment banks, already stinging from Europe contagion, when earnings come in. Research from Credit Suisse suggests 1Q trading revenue could be 25% lower. Banks are mired in red: BAC -3%, JPM -2.8%, C -3.8%, WFC -2.1%, MS -2.8%, GS -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 1 Comment

  • LinkedIn (LNKD +4.4%) is adding to Friday's gains, with its shares now at levels not seen since...

    LinkedIn (LNKD +4.4%) is adding to Friday's gains, with its shares now at levels not seen since its second trading day. The apparent cause is investor optimism that a sluggish job market will be a positive for the business networking site.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • NOG

    Northern Oil and Gas (NOG -8%) gets hammered after Dougherty cuts it to neutral. The firm says...

    Northern Oil and Gas (NOG -8%) gets hammered after Dougherty cuts it to neutral. The firm says April and May production for the oil and gas driller was adversely impacted by poor weather conditions, and actual growth will likely be in the high single digits, rather than earlier estimates of 25%-35%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • THQIQ

    In spite of heavy tech selling, THQ (THQI) shares are up 0.2% today. Over the weekend, the...

    In spite of heavy tech selling, THQ (THQI) shares are up 0.2% today. Over the weekend, the company announced its WWE Brawl wrestling game, due for release in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM

  • The VIX stays calm, even with dramatic headlines coming in by the hour from Europe. The market's...

    The VIX stays calm, even with dramatic headlines coming in by the hour from Europe. The market's volatility index, +7% for the day, still stands at a mild-reading sub-20 level, well-off the higher spikes in fear recorded in March and June.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • UNCFF

    After Italian regulator Consob ordered short-selling disclosures, speculation turns to whether a...

    After Italian regulator Consob ordered short-selling disclosures, speculation turns to whether a naked-shorting ban is ahead amid what some are calling a "speculative attack" on the country and its banks. UniCredit (OTCPK:UNCFF) -5.7%; Intesa Sanpaolo (OTCPK:ISNPY) -10.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • TJX

    Discount retailer TJX is trading +0.5% higher as Barclays upgrades the stock to Overweight on...

    Discount retailer TJX is trading +0.5% higher as Barclays upgrades the stock to Overweight on the back of June's strong sales. The firm says it expects the high promotional activity to continue into July, as retailers work to clear excess inventory.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • WYNN

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN -1.8%) receives an early boost after S&P upgrades the firm to the cusp of...

    Wynn Resorts (WYNN -1.8%) receives an early boost after S&P upgrades the firm to the cusp of investment-grade status and Nevada's gaming board cites soaring revenue on the Las Vegas Strip, before the sector tails off on pessimism. Shares of casino operators: MGM -5%, MPEL -1.7% LVS -3.4%, IGT -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • PETS

    PetMed Express (PETS -4%) dips after William Blair cuts it to Market Perform and lowers FY10...

    PetMed Express (PETS -4%) dips after William Blair cuts it to Market Perform and lowers FY10 growth projections. The firm cites concerns over Amazon.com's (NASDAQ:AMZN) growing influence in pet medicine, saying "a significant share of the items on 1800PetMeds.com can be found more cheaply on Amazon.com."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • NTSP

    NetSpend (NTSP -6.4%) dips on a Goldman downgrade. The firm sees margins weighed down by...

    NetSpend (NTSP -6.4%) dips on a Goldman downgrade. The firm sees margins weighed down by declining growth in the company's retailer distribution channel, plus ongoing regulatory challenges.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • JPM

    Those "cheap" bank stocks (XLF -2.3%) just keep getting cheaper, among the biggest decliners...

    Those "cheap" bank stocks (XLF -2.3%) just keep getting cheaper, among the biggest decliners today on the specter of debt crises on both sides of the Atlantic. It could get even worse, as big banks begin to report Q2 results later this week amid expectations of Q/Q revenue drops averaging as much as 25%. A sea of red: JPM -3%, BAC -2.8%, C -3.6%, WFC -2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 4 Comments
  • JNS

    Shares of Janus Capital (JNS -5.7%) lead the S&P 500 Index down. Morningstar says Janus...

    Shares of Janus Capital (JNS -5.7%) lead the S&P 500 Index down. Morningstar says Janus managers are struggling to keep up with funds picked solely by its analysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • NWS

    News Corp's (NASDAQ:NWS) "withdrawal of undertakings" at the Competition Commission lays a path...

    News Corp's (NASDAQ:NWS) "withdrawal of undertakings" at the Competition Commission lays a path for the U.K. to conduct a full competitive inquiry of the BSkyB takeover proposal, which could slow the process considerably. NWS -6%, BSYBY.PK -8%. (PR; previous developments)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • SHAW

    Shaw (SHAW -4.1%) takes a hit on a Baird downgrade. The firm says earnings estimates are...

    Shaw (SHAW -4.1%) takes a hit on a Baird downgrade. The firm says earnings estimates are overdone, and margins are likely to be impacted by charges stemming from a failed project, a pending $155M lawsuit, and capex delays following a recent EPA rule finalization.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • FN

    Optical and electronic manufacturing services firm Fabrinet (FN -11.5%) and optical component...

    Optical and electronic manufacturing services firm Fabrinet (FN -11.5%) and optical component maker Oclaro (OCLR -5.7%) are both trading lower after Oclaro gave notice that it will be terminating a supply agreement between the firms at the end of the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • NWS

    News Corp. (NASDAQ:NWS) "withdraws proposed undertakings" on its British Sky Broadcasting bid,...

    News Corp. (NASDAQ:NWS) "withdraws proposed undertakings" on its British Sky Broadcasting bid, and BSkyB (BSYBY.PK -7.5%) is down as much as 11% in London. Doesn't look like a dead bid, yet.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • KLAC

    Semiconductor stocks (SOXX -0.7%) outpace the broad market after Citigroup upgrades shares of...

    Semiconductor stocks (SOXX -0.7%) outpace the broad market after Citigroup upgrades shares of KLA Tencor (KLAC +1.1%) and Lam Research (LRCX +3.6%) on signs of stronger chip demand from Samsung (OTC:SSNLF). Citi's latest checks indicate that "Samsung has made its decision to bring back a large portion of the pushed-out shipments in [Q3]." (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM

  • Cotton futures slide -3.3% to 8-month lows on concern demand will slow down. A report over the...

    Cotton futures slide -3.3% to 8-month lows on concern demand will slow down. A report over the weekend showing Chinese imports grew last month at the slowest pace in 20 months hurt, as did an international trade report saying cotton prices will decline significantly this season due to slowing global demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • PSTI

    Pluristem Therapeutics (PSTI +5.1%) extends its gains following last Friday's report that...

    Pluristem Therapeutics (PSTI +5.1%) extends its gains following last Friday's report that Swedish doctors were able to replace the trachea of a patient with advanced cancer using stem cells.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • CMCSA

    Brean Murray initiates Comcast (CMCSA -0.7%) as a Buy, noting the firm's strong service profile...

    Brean Murray initiates Comcast (CMCSA -0.7%) as a Buy, noting the firm's strong service profile and lows levels of penetration provide an opportunity to outperform. Other industry calls by Brean: DirecTV (DTV -0.9%) and Dish Network (DISH -0.5%)  Buys, Time Warner Cable [[(TWC) -1.2%) and Cablevision (CVC -2.1%) Holds.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • NFLX

    While other firms worry about competition, Goldman is lifting its PT on Netflix (NFLX +1.6%) to...

    While other firms worry about competition, Goldman is lifting its PT on Netflix (NFLX +1.6%) to $330 from $300 on account of the company's Latin American expansion. Goldman is also raising its FY2012 and FY2013 EPS estimates due to higher forecasts for subscriber growth, average revenue per user (ARPU), and profit margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 6 Comments
  • LRCX

    Lam Research gains (LRCX +2.1%) after Citigroup raises its rating to Buy from Sell, and its...

    Lam Research gains (LRCX +2.1%) after Citigroup raises its rating to Buy from Sell, and its price target on the firm to $62 to $43. Shares are outgaining all issues listed on the NASDAQ-100.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • SNY

    Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY) -3.6% as the results of its Phase III trial for MS treatment Lemtrada...

    Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY) -3.6% as the results of its Phase III trial for MS treatment Lemtrada underwhelm. While the drug reduced the rate of relapses by 55% vs. Merck's (MRK -1.3%) Rebif, this was far less than the 74% Lemtrada achieved in a Phase II study. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • RUTH

    Ruth's Hospitality (RUTH +0.5%) gets a lift on positive comments from Jonathan Laing in...

    Ruth's Hospitality (RUTH +0.5%) gets a lift on positive comments from Jonathan Laing in Barron's. He notes same-store sales at the high-end steakhouse chain have risen nicely for the past four quarters. The stock could easily rally to $10 as analysts bump earnings estimates higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • HGG

    Electronics retailer Hhgregg (NYSE:HGG) is being cut to Market Perform by William Blair. The...

    Electronics retailer Hhgregg (NYSE:HGG) is being cut to Market Perform by William Blair. The firm believes Hhgregg to be especially vulnerable to losing market share to Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN), given its high level of product overlap and Amazon's lower prices. Shares -2.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • MITI

    Micromet (NASDAQ:MITI) says it entered into a collaboration agreement with Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN)...

    Micromet (NASDAQ:MITI) says it entered into a collaboration agreement with Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN) for the research of BiTE antibodies designed to direct the body's cell-destroying T-cells against tumor cells, representing a new therapeutic approach to cancer therapy. MITI +4.5%, AMGN -0.8% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • AMD

    JMP Securities' Alex Gauna is slashing AMD (-2.9% premarket) to Market Underperform, claiming...

    JMP Securities' Alex Gauna is slashing AMD (-2.9% premarket) to Market Underperform, claiming AMD's Fusion processors aren't faring well with PC OEMs and retailers. Gauna also believes OEMs could abandon AMD as their main alternative to Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) once PCs featuring chips using ARM Holdings (NASDAQ:ARMH) CPU cores arrive.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • LOGI

    Logitech (NASDAQ:LOGI) slumps 3.1% premarket, despite announcing new webcams and headsets for...

    Logitech (NASDAQ:LOGI) slumps 3.1% premarket, despite announcing new webcams and headsets for its business-class product line optimized to work for Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) products. Shares trade just off 52-week lows.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • ARJ

    Premarket gainers: ARJ +11%. AIS +8%. PSTI +6%. MITI +4%. SIRI +3%.Losers: ING -7%. NBG -6%....

    Premarket gainers: ARJ +11%. AIS +8%. PSTI +6%. MITI +4%. SIRI +3%.
    Losers: ING -7%. NBG -6%. BBVA -6%. STD -5%. IRE -5%. TEF -5%. TEF -5%. RENN -5%. E -5%. BCS -4%. DB -4%. LYG -4%. TS -4%. ALU -4%. CTIC -4%. NOK -4%. BUD -4%. TOT -4%. TSEM -4%. SI -3%. FRO -3%. CPST -3%. MT -3%. SDRL -3%. RCL -3%. CS -3%. STO -3%. AMD -3%. UN -3%. SINA -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • MOS

    Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) is appealing an injunction issued by a Florida district court late Friday that...

    Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) is appealing an injunction issued by a Florida district court late Friday that prevents the fertilizer company from extending its phosphate mine in South Florida. The decision stems from a Sierra Club lawsuit claiming the company is illegally expanding into wetlands territory. Shares -2.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • KNDI

    Kandi Technologies (NASDAQ:KNDI) is up 12.5% premarket after signing a strategic cooperation...

    Kandi Technologies (NASDAQ:KNDI) is up 12.5% premarket after signing a strategic cooperation agreement with Hangzhou Electric to enhance the launch of its electric vehicles.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • IRE

    The European Commission grants temporary approval for Bank of Ireland (IRE -4.7%) to receive up...

    The European Commission grants temporary approval for Bank of Ireland (IRE -4.7%) to receive up to €5.35B ($7.6B) in extra capital from the Irish government. Final approval is conditioned on a new restructuring plan from IRE, which is expected by month's end.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • LOCM

    Online business directory and local search provider Local.com (NASDAQ:LOCM), which shot higher...

    Online business directory and local search provider Local.com (NASDAQ:LOCM), which shot higher last week following a marketing deal with Google (NASDAQ:GOOG), will be acquiring Screamin' Daily Deals for $12.5M in cash, stock, and debt. Shares -1.1% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM | 2 Comments

  • Italian regulators order short-sellers to disclose their positions when they reach 0.2% or more...

    Italian regulators order short-sellers to disclose their positions when they reach 0.2% or more of a company's capital, with filing requirements for each additional 0.1%. The measure, in effect starting today, last until Sept. 9. Italy's FTSE MIB -3.1%; Italy ETF EWI -4.1% premarket; euro ETF FXE -1.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • DB

    European banks take a hit as debt contagion fears grow. DB -4%, UBS -1.2%, RBS -3.7%, ING -6.3%,...

    European banks take a hit as debt contagion fears grow. DB -4%, UBS -1.2%, RBS -3.7%, ING -6.3%, STD -4.6%, CS -2.8%, BCS -4%, HBC -1.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 AM | 2 Comments
  • NWS

    News Corp.'s (NWS -0.1%) hopes of buying BSkyB (BSYBY.PK) are fading after the U.K. government...

    News Corp.'s (NWS -0.1%) hopes of buying BSkyB (BSYBY.PK) are fading after the U.K. government says it will seek fresh regulatory advice about the acquisition following the phone-hacking scandal at the News of the World. In London, BSkyB -6.2%
     
     
     
     
    | 7:47 AM

  • The EU is holding an emergency meeting of top officials today on concern Europe's sovereign debt...

    The EU is holding an emergency meeting of top officials today on concern Europe's sovereign debt crisis could spread to Italy after a sharp sell-off in Italian assets on Friday. Five-year CDS on Italian bonds hit a record high this morning, and the euro is -0.9% against the dollar.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 AM
  • SIRI

    Sirius (NASDAQ:SIRI) is being added to the Nasdaq 100 index on Friday, and will be included in...

    Sirius (NASDAQ:SIRI) is being added to the Nasdaq 100 index on Friday, and will be included in the PowerShares QQQ ETF, which tracks the Nasdaq 100. SIRI +3.1%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:32 AM
  • SNY

    Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY) is selling its Dermik dermatology business to Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX)...

    Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY) is selling its Dermik dermatology business to Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) for $425M, saying the "divestiture allows us to rationalize our portfolio and improve focus on our core businesses." Premarket: SNY -1.8%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 AM
